name: Prince of Persia: Warrior Within™
description: Enter the dark underworld of Prince of Persia Warrior Within, the sword-slashing sequel to the critically acclaimed Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time™. Hunted by Dahaka, an immortal incarnation of Fate seeking divine retribution, the Prince embarks upon a path of both carnage and mystery to defy his preordained death.
minimum_requirements: Supported OS: Windows® 2000/XP (only)Processor: 1 GHz Pentium® III, AMD Athlon™, or equivalentMemory: 256 MB (512 MB recommended)Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce 3 or higher, ATI Radeon 7500 or higher, Intel 915G (NVIDIA GeForce 4 or ATI Radeon 9500, or higher recommended)*Sound: DirectX 9.0-compliant sound cardDirectX: DirectX 9.0cHard Disk Space: 1.5 GB available space for minimum installation, 2.2 GB available space for full installationSupported peripherals: Windows-compatible mouse (required), Dual analog gamepad*Note: For an up-to-date list of supported chipsets, video cards, and operating systems, please visit the FAQ for this game at: http://support.ubi.com.

reviews.review_text: Regardless of what everyone says, to me this is the most iconic Prince of Persia game and it surely will always have a place in my heart. Overall, it glitches a little from time to time, but it still holds its own in terms of gameplay, even with dated graphics. It is a great game.  Ubisoft, if you are out there, revamp this PoP trilogy!
An amazing series, and its best piece. You cannot change your fate. No man can. 10/10

Amazing game, the best in SoT series in my opinion! It's still entertaining even though it's old and has poor graphics and doesn't support widescreen resolutions. The only bug I encountered - I couldn't perform a long wall jump. Turns out, the cause was that the game was running at 150-200fps. I enabled V-Sync and the bug disappeared. The game certainly wasn't tested under such conditions back in the day:)
The best Prince of Persia ever, I so ♥♥♥♥ing love this game. :D
Hands down best PoP in the franchise.
Still a masterpiece.  As a reminder - make sure to keep vertical Sync on or you will have troubles with glitches and weired collisions

Despite many bugs, this game gives a lot of fun. Plot is awesome, fight is awesome and Prince is awesome. I recomend it, but you should have played Sands of Time to fully unnderstand everything and have more fun :)
That's my most favorite game ever. But i think it is hardly recommended for all gamers who love time travel subject

Warrior Within is the first sequel to Ubisoft's 2003 Sand of Time, taking place third Chronologically right after 2010's The Forgotten Sands. As I had said before SoT was an almost perfect game, with amazing story, unrivaled scenery, and perfect character arcs. Everything that lacked in that game this one improved, such as combat. However the once brown-haired insecure Daddy's boy Prince that was in the orginal is buried under a ♥♥♥♥♥♥-off emo hiding behind his black flowing hair and facial scars.   The game is not bad in any sense of the word, besides the horrible bugs that could cause you to skip ten hours of gameplay and be doomed to re-do or the most difficult battles in the series.. It's just darker and grittier, makes sense since he killed his own brother and been hunted like an animal ever since by the Dahaka.   If youre a fan of SoT it's worth the buy.

Best game EVER. Best Original Soundtrack ever written for anything ever existed. This masterpiece of a game is the milestone for its genre with it's complete and utter awesomeness on every single merit. 10/10
best game in the series

Finished it. The favourite part, it is like eigth or tenth walkthrough.  There is no point dividing the judgement into 2004 point of view and 2015. Everything (both + and - ) is actually the same.  The gameplay became much more diverse - more aggressive, different approaches, swords that really make a difference, a lot of secondary weapons to choose from. Definitely the exact improvement needed.  Change in past-present was as satisfying as ever - cannot recall any other game at that time with such concept.  The plot is twisted, providing unexpected turns and decisions. At least it was confusing 10 years ago for a 11-year boy. A lot of different bosses, each recquiring a different approach - by far, the greatest addition since the previous game.  You can play the game even if you didn't finish the SOT part. Still rewarding.

I loved this game back when it came out, and it was one of my favorite games ever. I was excited to play it again, but unfortunately it just doesn't work as well as it used to. Game needs controller support really badly, and it doesn't live up to the memories I had of it.

Kill me already, this game is so badly made and bad in general that it makes Pokemon: Snap look like it deserves game of the year. Wanna beat the first boss? Well good luck because you better have at least 200 hours into playing every other prince of persia game because this one is nearly unkillable. Good luck, youre gonna need it.

The battlesystem is great but the story is awful. Ubisoft ruined the Prince's personality by turning him into a cliché emo and his obsession of changing his fate made want to kill him myself or just let Dahaka do it for me.

After playing Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time I went in this with low expectations.  At first it seemed like they improved on the combat and overall gameplay but it sadly all comes down to the same in the end.  Enemies you'd rather ignore than fight just to get it over with. A map that is useless and music that is going to make your ears bleed after you heard the same song the millionth time.   Dont ever play on the hardest difficulty unless you want to lose your sanity.

Very good game. I remember playing this on my Gamecube back then. There are a tiny bit more bugs in the pc version then I thought, but they don't ruin the game. It is still one of my favorite game in the series! The Parcour in this game never gets repetitive, as well as the Boss fights and Dahaka chases.  What makes this game different are the secrets that you don't see on the first time. And when you find a secret you are like: 'Damn, there are certainly more!'.
Dark, brutal and good as hell.
This game is still good imo. Wonderful story and cool gameplay!
